alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Washington; Northern Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Washington County through 630 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Topsfield, or 17 miles south of Danforth, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Princeton, Topsfield, Grand Lake Stream, Dyer Township, Fowler Township, Codyville Plantation, Baileyville, Carroll, Waite, Codyville, Dyer and Fowler. This includes US Highway 1 between Princeton and Topsfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
